intro: Stylidium arenicola, commonly known as the sandhill stickleback, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its small, erect stature and distinctive, spurred flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, sandy environments, with reduced leaves and a deep root system to access water. Its flowers are typically pale green or yellowish, with a unique structure that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Stylidium arenicola is a rare and endangered species, requiring conservation efforts to protect its limited habitat.
